The apple at (4, 8) is extremely close - just 1 cell left and 1 cell up from my current head position at (5, 9). I can reach it in at most 2 more moves.

Moving DOWN puts me at (5, 8), which is directly below (4, 8). From there, I could move LEFT to (4, 8) next turn and collect the apple.

Alternatively, moving LEFT puts me at (4, 9), which is directly to the right of (4, 8). From there, I could also move DOWN to (4, 8) next turn.

Both DOWN and LEFT work toward the apple. DOWN is slightly more conservative as it doesn't move me further left (keeping more options open on the board). However, LEFT is more aggressive toward the apple.

I'll go with DOWN to maintain flexibility and safely approach the nearby apple.
